settings.name: Distance buffer for features in meters
settings.description: Specify a buffer distance with the feature to identify different behaviour. Be careful with the distance as different species behave differently to the feature.

settings.name: Maximum time for encounter events for crossing in hours
settings.description: Maximum duration, that an encounter event would be considered as a short event bounce or quick cross.

settings.name: Minimum time for encounter events for trapped in hours
settings.description: Specify a minimum duration, that an encounter event would be considered as a trapped condition.

settings.name: Buffer time around encounter events in hours
settings.description: The length of time, to include around the encounter event to calculate average movement straightness using a moving window. Locations included are all locations within `w/2` before the first location of the encounter event and `w/2` after the last location of the event.

settings.name: Road files
settings.description: You can upload local files for running the barrier intersection behaviour analysis. Make sure that they overlap with the tracking data set and are in WGS 84 projection! The App requires the following files, named exactly as given: 1. `roads.cpg`, 2. `roads.dbf`, 3. `roads.prj`, 4. `roads.shp`, 5. `roads.shx`. Note that fallback road files are provided, but they span only the Yukon to Yellowstone Region (Y2Y).

references.note: Xu W, Dejid N, Herrmann V, Sawyer H, Middleton AD. Barrier Behaviour Analysis (BaBA) reveals extensive effects of fencing on wide-ranging ungulates. J Appl Ecol. 2020;00:1–9.
